home.subtitle: Exploring Cardiac Regeneration Through Developmental Transcriptomics
home.research-focus1: Neonatal (P1 - P6) vs. Postnatal (P7+) Heart Regeneration Capacity:
home.research-focus2: Uncovering the molecular drivers of cardiomyocyte proliferation decline
home.gb-description: View how Genes differ in expression levels accross Age, Cell Groups and Experimental Conditions
home.igv-1: Use the search bar to navigate to a specific gene, or drag on the IGV window to select certain areas. You can view chromatin accessibility (Histone CHIP-seq) and methylation level (WGBS) tracks in IGV.
home.igv-2: Click "Get Differential Expression Data" to get data of each gene.

igv-key.d1: View comparison groups in the card body. You can compare P1 / P8 (Group 1) or Sham / MI (Group 2) currently.
igv-key.d2: Click the card to expand statistical data. Hit any data point on the scatter plot to show UMAP, TSNE and meta information.

pathway.title: Pathway Enrichment
pathway.subtitle: Explore how various pathways are impacted accross Age, and Experimental Conditions

card.d1: Start with gene list from differential expression results
card.d3: Adjust FDR cutoff using slider (default q < 0.05)
card.d4: Export network diagrams or table results

expression.title: Gene Expression
expression.subtitle: Compare gene expression levels across conditions through box plots

card.d1: Adjust criteria and enter gene symbol or Ensembl ID, then click "Add gene"
card.d2: Boxplots will then be added to the chart. Hover the box to see detailed data including max/min, q1/q3 and medium values.
card.d3: If you want to remove a gene, just click "Remove Gene" on the right sidebar.
card.d4: Please use the left sidebar to show or hide the columns in the boxplot.
card.d5: Store and retrieve your search criteria at any time.

download.title: Search and Download
download.subtitle: Download our Results from our Differential Gene Expression Analysis

card.d1: Modify any search criteria according to your need, then click "Search" button.
card.d2: Select samples in the table and click "Download Standardized Data" to start your download.
card.d3: All files were packed as zip format, as your browser may prevent downloading multiple files at the same time.

p3.btn-get: Get DEG data of entered genes

filterarea.note1: Numbers on the meta plot were hidden if the sample size is less than 2.

expression.adddescription: Select criteria and search for a gene to add with specific filter settings.
expression.search_placeholder: Enter gene symbol or Ensembl ID

description.d1: Each gene uses specific filter criteria
description.d3: Modify display options in left panel

centerpanel.d1: Select criteria and search for a gene to visualize expression data

popup.invalid_gene: Please enter a valid gene symbol or Ensembl ID
popup.nodata: No data found for the selected gene and conditions
popup.failed: Failed to load gene data. Please try again.

body.loading: Data loading. Click Apply to refresh.
body.d1: Clusters with cell type "All Cells" were shown as semi-transparent datapoints.
body.d2: All clusters with -Log10P-val less than 0.01 were hidden in the model plot by default.
body.d3: If you want to view all non-significant clusters, you can navigate to settings page and turn on the switch.

body.no-tsne: TSNE not available for this study

filterarea.go-d: Gene Ontology (GO) annotates and classifies gene sets through BP, CC, and MF.
filterarea.kegg-d: Kyoto Encyclopedia of Genes and Genomes (KEGG) looks at pathways through DEGs.

settings.displaymode-d: The website will follow your system's preferences by default.
settings.fontsize-d: System settings applied to this by default.
settings.nonsig-data-d: Clusters with Adjusted p-value 1.00 in DEG results
settings.yaxis-d: DEG results will always use -Log10(Adj P-val).
settings.language-d: Default language will be English if you use the website first time.

body.d: Downloading multiple or large files requires zipping in the backend side which may cause temporary slow down.

P8.def: Postnatal day 8 (transitional stage in cardiac development)

sham.def: Control surgery without myocardial infarction (MI) induction

psdx.def: Post-surgery Sequencing Date, i.e. how many days after the surgery were the hearts sequenced

p1vsp8.def: Comparing expression profile between P1 individuals against P8 individuals (base case)

shamvsmi.def: Comparing expression profile between MI individuals against Sham individuals (base case)

cell_defs.description: Cluster definition is based on a marker list which you could download:

bcell.name: B Cell
bcell.def: Lymphocytes that produce antibodies and contribute to the immune response in the heart.

cardiaccell.name: Cardiac Cell
cardiaccell.def: Specialized muscle cells (cardiomyocytes) responsible for heart contraction and electrical conduction.

cardiomyocytes.name: Cardiomyocyte Subtypes (1-5)
cardiomyocytes.def: Specialized cardiomyocyte subtypes identified through single-nucleus RNA sequencing (Cui et al., Dev Cell, 2020). These populations exhibit distinct responses to cardiac injury and regeneration.

1.name: Cardiomyocyte Subtype 1 (CM1)
1.def: The dominant cardiomyocyte population (50-75% of cells in P1/P8 hearts). Serves as the primary source for injury-responsive CM5 cells in non-regenerative hearts through transcriptional remodeling.
1.marker: Akap6, Ank2, Cacna1c, Camk2d, Cdh2, Celf2, Ctnna3, D830005E20Rik, Dip2c, Dmd

2.name: Cardiomyocyte Subtype 2 (CM2)
2.def: Minor population (4-6%) expressing cell-cycle genes. Maintains consistent levels in both regenerative and non-regenerative hearts without injury-responsive proliferation changes.
2.marker: Atad2, Bard1, Blm, Brca1, Brip1, Cdca2, Cenpk, Cenpp, Cep128, Cep192

3.name: Cardiomyocyte Subtype 3 (CM3)
3.def: Stable population (~14%) defined by dopaminergic metabolism gene expression (Ddc). Shows consistent presence across developmental stages without significant injury response changes.
3.marker: Akap6, Ank2, Cacna1c, Camk2d, Cdh2, Celf2, Ctnna3, D830005E20Rik, Dip2c, Dmd

4.name: Cardiomyocyte Subtype 4 (CM4)
4.def: Regeneration-competent immature cardiomyocytes enriched in P1 hearts (>20%) but nearly absent in P8 hearts (<4%). Characterized by embryonic gene expression (Tnni1, Myh7), glycolytic metabolism, and antioxidant activity. Shows dramatic cell-cycle entry post-injury (67% in G2/M phase at 3d post-MI) through NFYa-mediated proliferative programs.
4.marker: Actb, Actc1, Atp5a1, Atp5b, Atp5e, Atp5g1, Atp5g3, Atp5h, Atp5j, Atp5j2

5.name: Cardiomyocyte Subtype 5 (CM5)
5.def: Injury-responsive population localized to infarct border zones. Dramatically induced in P8 hearts post-MI (3.5% → 13%). Expresses cytoskeletal regulators (Xirp2, Cd44) and shows pseudotime progression from CM1. Undergoes apoptosis and NFEL2L1-mediated hypertrophic remodeling in non-regenerative hearts.
5.marker: mt-Co1, Gm42418, mt-Cytb, mt-Nd4, mt-Atp6, mt-Nd1, mt-Co3, mt-Co2, AY036118, Myl2

endothelial.name: Endothelial Cells (1-6)
endothelial.def: Endothelial clusters were identified and ranked by relative abundance, with Cluster 1 representing the most populous group.
endothelial.marker: Acta2, Cd300lg, Cd34, Cdh5, Ednrb, Egfl7, Emcn, Epas1, Kdr, Pecam1

weepc.name: Well-established Epicardial Progenitor Cell
weepc.def: Multipotent progenitor cells derived from the epicardium that give rise to cardiac fibroblasts, smooth muscle cells, and coronary vasculature during development and repair. Characterized by embryonic transcription factors and collagen production.
weepc.marker: Aldh1a2, Gata5, Tbx18, Tcf21, Wt1, ENSMUSG00000040254

fibroblast.name: Fibroblast (1-6)
fibroblast.def: Fibroblast clusters were identified and ranked by relative abundance, with Cluster 1 representing the most populous group.
fibroblast.marker: Acta2, Atxn1, Bcl6b, Bgn, Ckap4, Col1a1, Col1a2, Dcn, Ddr2, Tnnt2

ac-fibroblast.name: Activated Fibroblast
ac-fibroblast.def: Fibroblasts activated in response to cardiac injury.

granulocyte.name: Granulocyte
granulocyte.def: Immune cells, including neutrophils, eosinophils, and basophils, involved in inflammatory responses in cardiac tissue.

macrophage.name: Macrophage
macrophage.def: Immune cells that phagocytose debris and pathogens, contributing to inflammation and repair in the heart.

mural.name: Mural Cell
mural.def: Pericytes and vascular smooth muscle cells that support blood vessel stability and function in the heart.

progenitor.name: Progenitor Cell
progenitor.def: Multipotent cells capable of differentiating into various cardiac cell types during development or repair.

rbc.name: Red Blood Cell
rbc.def: Erythrocytes responsible for oxygen transport in the bloodstream, critical for cardiac tissue oxygenation.

sinoatrial.name: Sinoatrial Cell
sinoatrial.def: Specialized pacemaker cells in the sinoatrial node that initiate the heartbeat by generating electrical impulses.

tcell.name: T Cell
tcell.def: Lymphocytes involved in cell-mediated immunity, regulating immune responses in cardiac tissue.
